required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study on the Model School Pediatric Health Initiative Pilot Project
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study on the Model School Pediatric Health Initiative Pilot Project

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective cross sectional study to assess the feasibility of a school based health centre (SBHC) at Sprucecourt Public School, an inner-city elementary school in Toronto. The SBHC allows inner-city children who face barriers to accessing health care the opportunity to receive health care in their school. The primary aim of this study is to determine utilization of the SBHC. The secondary aims are a) to assess whether attending the SBHC resulted in important changes in health outcomes, and b) to compare rates of absenteeism from the first year of the SBHC to the year prior to implementation. Establishing feasibility of the SBHC would support further development and expansion of this program into other inner city schools.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Utilization of School Board Health Centres (SBHC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in Utilization of SBHC at 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The primary objectives are to determine utilization of the SBHC including: The number of students who are enrolled at the SBHC The number of enrolled students who attend the SBHC

secondary_outcome.description: The number of students triaged at the school support team meetings.
The number of cases referred from the school support team to the SBHC
The number of referred cases who attend the SBHC

secondary_outcome.measure: Sprucecourt Public School vs. Other Participating Schools
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the numbers of students who attend the SBHC from Sprucecourt Public School (the school which houses the SBHC) with the number of students who attend the SBHC from the other participating schools.
New treatment plans established at the clinic.

other_outcome.description: New diagnoses established at the clinic.
Compare absenteeism in the school with the year preceding the SBHC.
Determine OHIP status of students attending the clinic.

arm_group.description: Students who attend the SBHC from either Sprucecourt Public School or any other participating schools.

study_pop.textblock: All students of Sprucecourt Public School as well as the fourteen surrounding inner city public schools and their siblings. All children attending the on-site Parenting and Family Literacy Centre.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All students at Sprucecourt Public School and the surrounding fourteen schools, as well as their siblings (ages 0-12 years), who are enrolled at and have consent to attend the SBHC
- All infants and preschool aged children attending the on-site Parenting and Family Literacy Centre who are enrolled at the SBHC
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A
